concept.title: When to Change a Typewriter Ribbon
concept.shortdesc: The clarity and visibility of typed text indicate when a typewriter ribbon requires replacement.

conbody.p: Over time, the ink on a typewriter ribbon fades as it transfers to paper through repeated use. When this occurs, the typed characters begin to appear faint or semi-transparent, suggesting that the ribbon has lost sufficient ink saturation to produce crisp impressions.

section.title: Visual Indicators
section.p: The most common sign that a ribbon requires replacement is the appearance of pale or see-through letters on the page. These visual changes reflect the depletion of ink and reduced transfer efficiency during typing.
